children.name: Example
children.text: var sysid = sn_discovery.DiscoveryAPI.discoverIpAddress("11.23.125.39");

children.name: application
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. Application configured for the MID Server.

To define a source parameter but not an application parameter, use "NULL" as the place holder.

Default: Discovery

children.name: String
children.text:
Discovery status record sys_id.
The following exceptions can be thrown during MID Server selection:
  • NoSuitableMidServerFoundException: No appropriate MID Server available for this Discovery
  • BadArgumentException: Invalid argument detected during MID Server selection

children.name: ipAddress
children.text: String

children.name: source
children.text: String
children.text2:
Optional. Source of the Discovery. This same value appears in the optional Source field in the Discovery Status record, which indicates how the Discovery was triggered.

Default: Discovery_API

children.name: discoverIpAddress(String ipAddress, String application, String source)
children.text: Discovers a specified IPv4 address.
children.text2: A MID Server is selected automatically, based on the IP address provided or the application specified.

children.name: ipAddress
children.text: string
children.text2: The IPv4 address that was scanned.

children.name: Example
children.text: var ipResultObj = sn_discovery.DiscoveryAPI.reportCiIpAddressStatus(ipAddress, discoveryStatus);

children.name: array
children.text: JavaScript array of immutable ReportCiStatusOutputJS objects.

children.name: discoveryStatusSysId
children.text: string
children.text2:
The sys_id of the Discovery status record for the IP address that was
                scanned.

children.name: reportCiIpAddressStatus(Object ipAddress, Object discoveryStatusSysId)
children.text:
Used to return a summary of a configuration item's Discovery status given the specific
    status sys_id and IPv4 address.
children.text2:
The following exceptions can be thrown:

  • DiscoveryStatusNotFoundException: Displays this message: Discovery Status with sys id '<invalid value>' does not exist
  • DiscoveryDeviceHistoryNotFoundException: Device History with Discovery Status sys id '<invalid value>' and ipAddress '<invalid value>' does not exist
  • IllegalArgumentException (invalid input arguments): This argument exception prevents input values from being null.
    • Discovery Status sys id can not be null
    • ipAddress can not be null
  • IllegalArgumentException (values stored in database): This argument exception prevents erroneous data from being returned to the caller in the case of bad attribute values.
    • Discovery Status 'state' property can not be null
    • Device history 'source' property can not be null
    • Device history 'issues' property is not an integer: <invalid value>
    • Device history 'issues' property can not be less than 0: <invalid value>

children.name: Example
children.text: var ipResultObjArray = sn_discovery.DiscoveryAPI.reportCiStatus(discoveryStatus); for(var idx=0; idx < ipResultObjArray.length; idx++) { var ipResultObj = ipResultObjArray[idx];

children.name: array
children.text: JavaScript array of immutable ReportCiStatusOutputJS objects.

children.name: sys_id
children.text: string
children.text2: The sys_id of a Discovery status record.

children.name: reportCiStatus(Object discoveryStatusSysId)
children.text:
Used to return a summary of a CI Discovery status given a specific Discovery Status
    sys_id.
children.text2:
The following exceptions can be thrown:

  • DiscoveryStatusNotFoundException: Discovery Status with sys id '<invalid value>' does not exist
  • DiscoveryDeviceHistoryNotFoundException: Device History with Discovery Status sys id '<invalid value>' and ipAddress '<invalid value>' does not exist
  • IllegalArgumentException (invalid input arguments): This argument exception prevents input values from being null.
    • Discovery Status sys id can not be null
    • ipAddress can not be null
  • IllegalArgumentException (values stored in database): This argument exception imposes post conditions on database access values.
    • Discovery Status 'state' property can not be null
    • Device history 'source' property can not be null
    • Device history 'issues' property is not an integer: <invalid value>
    • Device history 'issues' property can not be less than 0: <invalid value>

name: DiscoveryAPI
text: The methods of the DiscoveryAPI - Scoped class launch a quick Discovery of a single IPv4 address and return summaries of previously launched Discovery statuses for a single CI or for all scanned CIs.

children.name: string
children.text:
The three possible states returned by this method are:
  • Processing: Discovery is still processing the request.
  • Successful: A CI was created or updated.
  • NotSuccessful: A CI was not created or updated, and the Discovery status was Completed or Cancelled.

children.name: Example
children.text: var ipResultObj = sn_discovery.DiscoveryAPI.reportCiIpAddressStatus(ipAddress, discoveryStatus); gs.info("ipResultObj(CiOperationStatus): " + ipResultObj.getCiOperationStatus());

children.name: getCiOperationStatus()
children.text: Used to return the state of the scanned CI.
children.text2: This is a calculated field based on the last_state field in discovery_device_history table and the state field in the discovery_status table.

children.name: Example
children.text: var ipResultObj = sn_discovery.DiscoveryAPI.reportCiIpAddressStatus(ipAddress, discoveryStatus); gs.info("ipResultObj(cmdb): " + ipResultObj.getCmdbCI());

children.name: string
children.text:
Sys_id of the CI created or updated. This value can be null in the case of
                intermediate results before a CI is created.

children.name: getCmdbCI()
children.text:
Used to return the value in the cmdb_ci field from the discovery_device_history table
    for the CI being scanned.

children.name: Example
children.text: var ipResultObj = sn_discovery.DiscoveryAPI.reportCiIpAddressStatus(ipAddress, discoveryStatus); gs.info("ipResultObj(discoveryState): " + ipResultObj.getDiscoveryState());

children.name: string
children.text:
The possible states returned by this method are:
  • Starting
  • Active
  • Complete
  • Cancelled

children.name: getDiscoveryState()
children.text: Used to return the value from the State field in the Discovery Status [discovery_status] table.
children.text2: The values returned by this method are used to calculate the value returned by the getCiOperationStatus() method

children.name: string
children.text: The IP address of the CI being scanned.

children.name: Example
children.text: var ipResultObj = sn_discovery.DiscoveryAPI.reportCiIpAddressStatus(ipAddress, discoveryStatus); gs.info("ipResultObj(IpAddress): " + ipResultObj.getIpAddress());

children.name: getIpAddress()
children.text:
Used to return the value from the source field in the discovery_device_history table
    for the CI being scanned.

children.name: Example
children.text: var ipResultObj = sn_discovery.DiscoveryAPI.reportCiIpAddressStatus(ipAddress, discoveryStatus); gs.info("ipResultObj(issues): " + ipResultObj.getIssues());

children.name: integer
children.text: Number of issues in this Discovery for this CI.

children.name: getIssues()
children.text:
Used to return the value from the issues field in the discovery_device_history table
    for the CI being scanned.

children.name: string
children.text:
The issues_link field from the discovery_device_history table.

This value may be null or an anchor tag defining a hyperlink to a page that provides the list of issues associated with the Discovery Status and CI (IP address).

children.name: Example
children.text: var ipResultObj = sn_discovery.DiscoveryAPI.reportCiIpAddressStatus(ipAddress, discoveryStatus); gs.info("ipResultObj(issues_link): " + ipResultObj.getIssuesLink());

children.name: getIssuesLink()
children.text:
Used to return the value from the issues_link field in the discovery_device_history
    table for the CI being scanned.

children.name: string
children.text: Serialized instance of the ReportCiStatusOutputJS object into a JSON string.

children.name: Example
children.text: var ipResultObj = sn_discovery.DiscoveryAPI.reportCiIpAddressStatus(ipAddress, discoveryStatus); gs.info("ipResultObj(json): " + ipResultObj.toJson());

children.name: toJson()
children.text: Used to serialized the ReportCiStatusOutputJS object.
children.text2: This method throws the IllegalArgumentException exception, Cannot serialize object, e when the method is unable to serialize the object. The e is the exception object, which provides the exception message and trace.

name: ReportCiStatusOutputJS
text: The ReportCiStatusOutputJS methods are getters that return specific object properties for the DiscoveryAPI reportCiIpAddressStatus method and then convert the information into a JSON string.
